questions.question: Which authentication protocol is widely used for secure remote access?

questions.correctAnswer: Separates public-facing systems from internal networks
questions.explanation: A DMZ reduces the risk of external attacks affecting critical internal systems.

questions.question: Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS) differ from IDS because they:

questions.question: Which protocol is used to securely transfer files between systems?
